goal.ch: 本課程旨在創意性地探討並瞭解文化創意產業經營與管理。在文化經濟興盛的脈絡下，企圖瞭解當代文化產業──主要指涉入象徵生產與流通之過程整體的產業化與商品化──我們不僅當辨明針對工業化商品的操作與支配，同時也應探討更深入且複雜的領域，像是傳播、創新、創意與結構權力關係重構的浮現。內醞關鍵文化創發特質的文化產業不僅提供經濟財富且創造象徵形式、發展創新知識，建構認同、表達願景、反映價值、促成關係且可以成為人類社會的關鍵文化資產。本課程將引介、闡釋並解析文化產業發展的主要理論，並介紹、探索當代地方文化產業與生活產業中（如，節慶產業和觀光產業）的主要議題與關鍵趨勢。本課程將沿著兩條軸線展開：其一，從不同的新興社會理論傳統來探索並釐清「文化產業」此具有軸心地位的現象與概念架構。另一方面，運用社會文化的理論取徑並以將社會關係與文化過程以更完整、更豐富且更貼近真實的分析方式，來瞭解當代地方文化產業與生活產業生活產業的運作與意涵。本課程在較完整的瞭解當今社會科學如何探討「文創產業」的議題的同時，也提供如何從事「文創產業」相關研究的概觀。
goal.en:
This course aims to creatively explore and understand the management and operation of the cultural and creative industries. In the context of a flourishing cultural economy, the course seeks to comprehend the contemporary cultural industries—mainly referring to the industrialization and commodification of the overall processes involved in symbolic production and circulation. We must not only distinguish the manipulation and domination of industrialized products but also delve into more profound and complex areas such as communication, innovation, creativity, and the emergence of restructured power relations. Cultural industries, which nurture key characteristics of cultural creation, not only provide economic wealth but also create symbolic forms, develop innovative knowledge, construct identities, express visions, reflect values, foster relationships, and serve as crucial cultural assets for human society.

This course will introduce, explain, and analyze the main theories of cultural industry development, and explore key issues and trends in contemporary local cultural and lifestyle industries (e.g., festival and tourism industries). The course will proceed along two axes: first, it will explore and clarify the central phenomenon and conceptual framework of “cultural industries“ from different emerging social theory traditions. Secondly, it will employ socio-cultural theoretical approaches to provide a more comprehensive, rich, and realistic analysis of the operation and significance of contemporary local cultural and lifestyle industries. This course not only aims to provide a thorough understanding of how contemporary social sciences address issues in the “cultural and creative industries,“ but also offers an overview of how to conduct research related to these industries.
